1.content:
Welcome to our little story. I know you want to get right into the juicy stuff, so I'll start you off. The first step is to choose which character you wish to follow.

First, there's Matt. Matt is a music major at FGU. He loves writing and performing songs. With his dark, unkempt hair and his deep green eyes, he's sure to provide some interesting directions...

Next, we have Mike. Mike is a football player for FGU. With a strong build, he has mad himself welll known to opponents for his crushing power on the field. Off the field, his straight blond hair and sparkling blue eyes have gotten him noticed too...

Another good choice is Joey, the frat boy. Always fun at parties, Joey has an infectious laugh and a killer smile. His tight body is well known to some of the other students, often envied and admired, he's easy-going and relaxed...

Our fourth choice is Brian. Brian is a law student at FGU. Following in his father's footsteps, Brian has come to college to study, but is also having some fun too. he enjoys the company of friend and hopes to find his match at college...

Last, but certianly not least, we have Cal. Cal, short for calvin, doesn't really know what he wants to do with his life. he enjoyed playing sports in high school, but knows that he could never live the life of a professional athlete. And he loves music and law, but he finds himself leaning more torward the world of poetry and art. Where will he end up?

That's up to you! Now laidies and gentlemen, pick your ponies and lets get this show on the road!

11.content:
You've chosen to follow Matt's life at FGU.

Before we continue with the story process, lets learn a little more about Matt.

**********


Matt sighed deeply as he looked up at the university dorms infront of him. Here he was, finally at college. Go, he was happy to be here.

Behind Matt, his dad was pulling out suitecases from the trunk of the car. When he saw Matt just standing there, he said "Hey, get your butt back over here. Your the one who's moving in here, not me!"

Matt couldn't help but crack a smile at his dad's comment. "Relax, dad," Matt said, turning around to help.

"I might as well be moving in here, with the amount I'm paying for this place." Matt knew that his dad was making a joke, but he also knew that his parents were sacrificing alot to send him to FGU. Hopefully, though, he would be able to find a way to lessen the burden. Next semester, he would be eligable to apply for a music scholarship. He wasn't eligable this semester because he found out too late to apply, but he was prepared for next semester.

When the last of his stuff had been emptied from the car, he gave both his parents a hug and a kiss. "Now you be a good boy, and keep your room clean. You never know when you might find someone special to bring back to your room," Matt's mother said.

"Oh, come on, honey. Matt's mind is gonna be on his studies," Matt's dad said, "make us proud, college boy."

Matt watched his parents drive off, then turned back to his stuff and started carrying his bags into the dorms. "Hi, I'm Matt Bryant, and I'm here to register for my dorm room and classes," he said as he walked up to the registration desk.

1222112.content:
Mike has completely transformed himself from a good looking, well dressed, college jock to an obese smelly hog. His fixation with Max caused him to model his life around becoming just like him. He succeeded. The transformation was dramatic. Mike was obese, out of shape, gross, smelly, just like Max. If he hoped that becoming like Max would make Max appreciate him, he was wrong. Max's contempt for Mike when he was a preppy, college boy didn't change when Mike became a slob. It wasn't even because Max was straight because he wasn't. Max was into guys alright. It's just that his preference was tiny, effeminate guys who were very clean and wore lots of perfume.
Max didn't even want to hang out with Mike even though Mike could match every gross behavior that Max had.
Mike's family had told him not to bother coming home until he could put his life back but even after that, Mike still loved his new life. He loved the effect that his presence had. Nobody ignored him these days. He supposed it was the odor but he had long since stopped noticing. Maybe it was the rude noises that came from Mike's flabby, obese body. Maybe it was his long ratty beard or greasy hair or the fact that he would eat anything from food left on plates in the cafeteria to the bags of stale food in the trash of fast food restaurants. He still shared a dorm room with Max but only because nobody else wanted to be near them. Mike is still hot for Max but by now he would settle for just a little recognition. The dorm room is barely big enough for the two fatties and yet Max will only speak to Mike when absolutely necessary.It is hell for Mike but at least he is close to the man he loves and idolizes.
Then one day Max drops the bomb.
"Preppy!" he calls to Mike. "Listen up. I don't want to tell you twice. I've been stuck with your sorry ass for a year now because the housing office says I have to stay here and smell your raunchy ass. I'm taking things into my own hands. I'm moving out. Joey's got an apartment off campus. When you get back from class tomorrow, I'll by gone."
With that, Max turned and waddled majestically out the door leaving Mike speechless.

After showering, Mike hit the Caf. He loaded up his tray, taking advantage of the All-you-can-eat style of the place, and then went to sit with some old buddies from high school.

Greg and Reese where total opposites, although they were good friends. The three boys had been hanging out together since high school, and were very pleased to discover they would all be attending FGU. Often times, Mike was amazed that Greg and Reese could manage to be in the same room without strangling each other, let alone enjoy one another’s company.

Greg and Mike had been on the football team together until he had torn his ACL in their senior year, ending Greg’s football career. Even now, Greg’s knee was regularly bound and he attended physical therapy at least once a week. He was tall and lanky with dark skin hair and eyes, and at the height of his football career was extremely athletic.

Reese on the other hand, hated all forms of physical activity. This coupled with his large appetite made Reese extremely large, particularly around the midsection, as he had been for as long as Mike had known him. He was as fair as Greg was dark and had a spat of thick red hair atop his head.

“Hey Mike.” Said Reese as Mike set his tray down on the table and slid into the booth next to Greg

“How was practice?” Greg chimed in and Mike thought he detected a note of bitterness in his voice. Mike knew he really missed football.

“Long and hard.” Mike said tiredly.

“Must’ve been, with all the food you’ve got there.” Greg smirked, eyeing Mike’s plate.

“You’re one to talk.” Mike quipped, digging in to some mashed potatoes. “You’ve been packing on the pounds lately, champ.” He reached down and patted his friend’s midsection tauntingly.

A light flush graced Greg’s dark cheeks as he too looked down at his midriff, which had expanded considerably since his days on the football team. His t-shirt was stretched tightly over a small paunch the blubbered over the waistband of Greg’s jeans. Mike could see an inch or two of skin that his shirt was two small to cover, exposing the bottom part of a chunky potbelly.

“Shut up.” Greg snapped, tugging his t-shirt down to cover his gut. “I’ll lose it all as soon as my knee’s better.

“Hey, Greg lighten up.” Reese said through a large bite of pizza rubbing his own rather larger gut. “There’s nothing wrong with putting on a few pounds. After all real men have guts.” He patted his fat belly fondly and then turned to Mike. “And don’t you get to cocky. The freshman fifteen had no sympathy. You’ll be fat too, before you know it.”

From his brother's description, the initiation for legacies was easy, but Joey didn't presume anything. On the night pledging began, he sat in a chair before a table of the officers; the same brothers who had been on his couch a year prior. They tried to look official; even dressed in suits, but when you've seen a group of boys in a drunken dog pile in your foyer, it's hard to ever take them seriously again.

Sam, who was apparently now the president, spoke first. "Your brother probably told you about legacy initiation. It's a seperate process from new initiates, but in many ways more difficult to complete. You have one month to convince each of us, individually, that you should be a member of our fraternity."

"How?"

"How to do it, and what it will take, are things you'll have to discover on your own. The only rule is, you can not speak a word to us until the end of the month, when we are seated here again. The vote must be unanimous."

Joey had no idea what they were looking for. Convince them he was worthy, without saying a word? He decided to ask around, and talk to the current brothers to see if they had any hints. One of the brothers, Tom, Joey remembered Marc mentioning. At the party later that night, he pulled Tom aside.

"How do I do it? How do I convince them to let me in?"
"You have to do it in order, up the line of officers, from Treasurer up to President. So first Harry, then Greg, Justin and Sam."

"So what will it take to convince Harry?"

"Oh Harry's easy. He's always been the heaviest kid in the frat, ever since he joined, and he's looking for someone to take his place. Convince him that you're serious about eating, and you'll have his vote."

"And Greg?"

"Drink him under the table. Which is simple, but not easy. You'll have to warm up to it first."

"Justin?"

"I'm pretty sure you've already got Justin's vote. I'll talk to him and let you know once you get past Harry and Greg."

There was a pause in which Joey notably didn't ask about Sam, and Tom felt he had to comment.

"You don't want to know about Sam?"

"I know how to get Sam's vote already," Joey said. He'd been planning for Sam's vote ever since a year ago. The next day, he set about getting Harry's vote. Getting into the cafeteria was easy. All freshman were essentially forced to take a nearly limitless meal plan, so they couldn't possibly run out of food. The trick for Joey was, he had to be there enough, and eat heavily enough, that it would catch Harry's attention.

Pancakes were legitimately his favorite food, so convincing Harry or not, he piled his plate high and ate several short stacks. Justin laughed. "Oh, don't worry you've got it. You're obviously cool and fun and flexible, and will be an asset to the frat. I'm not gonna make you jump through hoops. I will say it's nice to have another gay guy, but it wasn't required to get my vote or anything."

Joey smiled nervously and stopped eating. He and Tom had agreed to keep quiet about their thing. People had seen him coming out of Tom's room in the morning, but friends sleeping over was not uncommon at the house; Tom even had a sleeping bag laid out on the floor.

Justin laughed again. "Don't worry, it's a semi-secret. Those who would care won't figure it out, and those who know what's going on don't care. I wouldn't say anything until after your initiation, but once you're a brother, don't worry about sneaking. I certainly don't."

Harry chose that moment to stumble in. Justin had another strawberry smoothie at the ready, and he kissed Harry on the forehead as he handed it to him. After he'd had a few sips, Harry looked at Justin in a way that surprised Joey that he'd ever thought of the boy as straight.

"You let him talk, didn't you."

Justin only smiled. Harry was smiling too as he turned to Joey and said "No respect for our traditions. Good work, last night, and the past two weeks, Joey. Any plans on how to get Sam?"

Harry dug into a stack of pancakes and eggs that would have normally fed three people.

"I was just going to finish what we started that night at my parents house."

Harry dropped his fork and Justin smiled wide. "I knew it! Pay up, Harry. Pay. Up."

"What happened? All we saw was Marc and Sam come down red faced."

Joey told them the story of Sam's advances and Marc's interruption. They oohed and aahed in all the right places but when he was done, Justin expressed concern.

info.brief_description: The boys at a small local college gain a lot more than just an education.
info.description:
Five different boys from the Small college of FGU are going to be taking their own little journeys into getting fat. They migh be gay or straight. Their journey's might be centered around magic, science, or perhapse relationships. you decide how to build their lives as they go from hunks to hulks!

*** Rules ***

The idea of this story is to make some college boys fat. The first three levels of chapters decide what plot line ou want to build on, so from there, you can build on the basics, and make the boys grow. Use your immaginations, and no endings allowed. If you don't know how to go on, leave unspecific choices. This is almost more of an experiment than a story, but we'll se how it goes
